Speaker: spider
Dialogue: Say, hey, Cub fans, I hope to hell y'all down there cause we got a big game today.

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: O.K. Home Team. Ready in the bullpen.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Where's Cragie?

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Ready sir. Left Field in position.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: Have a shot, kid. A little nerve tonic.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: What's the matter with you?

Speaker: kobas
Dialogue: Just turning on Paulina.

Speaker: spider
Dialogue: How y'all doin?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Found you a present.

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: Shit, those things will fuck up your mind.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: If you gotta take a leak, do it now.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: I can't go wading in with my shlong flapping in the wind.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: Sure you can. It's called diversionary tactics.

Speaker: music
Dialogue: What the hell is this cat up to?

Speaker: brennan
Dialogue: Going to work asshole. What do you think.

Speaker: music
Dialogue: At this hour.

Speaker: brennan
Dialogue: They got a hardass for a boss. Like us.

Speaker: spider
Dialogue: This be better than jukin' Seven- Elevens, huh Victor?

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: I don't juke anybody.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: I say, awright. The royal colors.

Speaker: luna
Dialogue: Okay, by the numbers.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Everybody on your toes.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: What the hell you talking about?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Painters? That building's gonna be condemned!

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Play Ball! Play-fucking-ball!

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: Home Team! We're goin in! Move it! Move it!

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: I knew it.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Police! No se mueve!

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: They're goin out the front!

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Cragie?!

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: It's O.K. I got the sonovabitch.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: Police! Stay where you are!

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Take it easy, Kosalas.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: The kid didn't dust him. I did.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: Him or me, Sarge.  The kid saw the whole thing.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: Tell him, Nick.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Yeah, that's how it went down.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Take care of your partner.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Call Luis.

Speaker: kobas
Dialogue: Get these people back out of here, wouldja.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: Look, it's no big thing, Kid. A friggin' dog and pony show. Some dumb ass questions by dumb ass bureaucrats. "When's the last time you were at the range?" Crap like that.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Look. It was a fuckin' accident. Why can't you just be --

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: We stick together on this, kid. We're partners, right?

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: Aw man, don't do that. You know how much these things cost?

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: Eddie. Scam this. A bait shop. Worms, minnows. Don't even need real worms. Storage problem. Got those rubber ones, you know?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Yeah, what about the winter?

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: We winter in Florida. Rubber neck the beach bunnies. Aw, look at that. Ruined my brand new fence climbers. Hand made in Italy.

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: Oh, fuck, Partida. I'm gonna tell her you shot me.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: Cusack. You were in charge here?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Does it look like it?

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: And you were a principal in one of the shootings?

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: OW! A goddamn Dr. Jekyll!

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: Where's the officer who was involved in the other shooting?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Third floor rear.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Catch you later, Hopalong.

Speaker: music
Dialogue: You know that, Efren. When your big bad brother Luis gets the word, your ass is freeze dried and fried.

Speaker: brennan
Dialogue: Talk you hemorrhoid!

Speaker: pompas
Dialogue: Your mother fucks dogs in the street.

Speaker: brennan
Dialogue: You wanna tune-up? Hey Sarge, you know why a Comacho's like a cue-ball? Cause the harder you hit 'em, the better their English gets.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: We're jerking off here.

Speaker: sanchez
Dialogue: Let's cut the shit, Cusack.

Speaker: sanchez
Dialogue: Option 1: you can send em downtown. If Judge Collins didn't get laid last night, you can probably get him to arraign my clients for loitering in their own hallway. He'll set bail. I'll take care of it. Option 2: release them here and now and we'll call it a day.  Up to you.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I like to see you earn your money.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: We come up the back stairs. We start cleanin' the hallway when the deceased pops out of a doorway with a 25 automatic. I tell him to drop it, but he's comin. We had no choice. Kosalas here saw the whole thing.

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: Did you?

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: I was on another doorway...

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: But you saw the action?

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: I saw him fall.

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: And the kid was armed?

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: That's the way it went down.

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: And you saw the weapon?

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Yes sir. I saw it in his hand.

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: O.K.  Cragie, you'll be assigned to headquarters until the hearing --

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: Hearing? Who called for a hearing? The little fuck tried to shoot me in the back!

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: Ms. Partida --

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: That piece of shit!

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: Shut-up, Cragie.  An OPS Review Board member is waiting to talk to you. Doesn't sound like you got anything to worry about.

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: Kosalas, you work with Cusack until this is over.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Yes sir.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I ain't got no time to nursmaid a rookie. I don't need a partner.

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: You're going to have me back on a beat busting perverts in the park.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: We got a bigger problem. These Comachos aren't gonna take this lying down. The animals are out of the cages.

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: Just what I need. A goddman war.

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: Keep track of this business with Cragie?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: I'll deal with upstairs.

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: Just get me some answers, huh.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: That's my job.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: ...you have the right to remain silent. You have the right to have an attorney present at all times. Anything you say may be used against you in a court of law...

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I'm going to have to fix that.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: You know, it's kind of interesting. That 16 year old in the hallway with the gun? Partida told me he doesn't have a record. The kid's never been arrested.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Yeah, well, you know, if you read the papers, cops only shoot honor students. Sole support of the family and all that.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Nice fellow this Luis Comacho. Donato says they call him the Angel-of-Death.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Real sweetheart.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Mama!

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Daddy, would you get that!

Speaker: theresa
Dialogue: Bella.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Keep 'em closed now.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: O.K., open 'em.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Happy birthday, momma.

Speaker: theresa
Dialogue: Happy birthday, Molly.

Speaker: tony luna
Dialogue: Molly! Pack me a bag! Quick! Ok? C'mon I'm in a hurry!

Speaker: molly
Dialogue: But Tony, why...?

Speaker: tony luna
Dialogue: Business! C'mon, move. Do what I tell you!

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Don't do it, momma! Make him pack his own bag.

Speaker: tony luna
Dialogue: I ain't got time to put up with your bullshit today.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Listen goddammit! It's momma's birthday! She deserves better'n this!

Speaker: gamiani
Dialogue: Hey, Tony. What's shaking? Sorry I'm late. I got stuck on Wacker. Some spook...

Speaker: tony luna
Dialogue: Victor Comacho is alive.

Speaker: gamiani
Dialogue: Oh sweet Jesus.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You can't go now.

Speaker: tony luna
Dialogue: Shut up!

Speaker: tony luna
Dialogue: Put someone on the house. And you keep an eye on her.

Speaker: gamiani
Dialogue: You got it, Tony. What about your uncle?

Speaker: tony luna
Dialogue: What Felix don't know doesn't hurt him.

Speaker: tony luna
Dialogue: Here. Happy birthday.

Speaker: odell
Dialogue: Bow to your master!

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Later, Odell. It's been a rough one.

Speaker: odell
Dialogue: Y' tellin me! We all seen it on the TV!

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Bow to your master.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Hey, Odell. Here, make yourself crazy.

Speaker: pirelli
Dialogue: You look like shit.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Thanks, pal.

Speaker: pirelli
Dialogue: They had a shot on the tube of you guys comin' out in front of the building. How's Donato?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Pissed cause he lost a shoe.  Luis Comacho is in town.

Speaker: pirelli
Dialogue: He'll collect himself some scalps before this one's over. Your answering machine is on the fritz again. Some woman with a fantastic voice was callin' about comin' over this weekend ta help you with somthin', and then the tape went nuts.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Want somthin' to drink?

Speaker: pirelli
Dialogue: Does the Pope shit in the woods? Is a bear Catholic?

Speaker: odell
Dialogue: Me too.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I hate smart ass kids.

Speaker: pirelli
Dialogue: Gonna get down in the 30's tonight. Your pilot light is out.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I've been told that more than once.

Speaker: pirelli
Dialogue: So, who you figure pulled out the rug? Gypsies? Mob?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Somebody knew what they were doin'. They blew the top off an anthill.

Speaker: pirelli
Dialogue: I'd figure the Mob but Scalese ain't that stupid.  Hah! Sombody put the valve in backwards.

Speaker: odell
Dialogue: Later, fellas.

Speaker: pirelli
Dialogue: There. Heat.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: What was the Cubs final score?

Speaker: pirelli
Dialogue: Machines just don't like you.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Maybe I don't like machines.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Arretez! Halten Zie! Stop! Do not move! No se mueve!...

Speaker: engineer
Dialogue: ...After the gyros are locked, any movement of the hand controller is duplicated by the 'Prowler.'

Speaker: engineer
Dialogue: This simple control system means that even semi-skilled employees can operate the unit with a minimum of training. As they say, "Even a child can operate it."

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: He's talking about you, Cusack. Pay attention. You're all gonna have to be qualified on this. It's the future.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Just what the world needs, another gun without a brain.

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: You're looking at the perfect cop. The damn thing follows orders.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I got better things to do than play with toys.

Speaker: engineer
Dialogue: If the Commander will pick someone to try and elude 'Prowler,' we can show how our various target acquisition systems function.

Speaker: machine
Dialogue: Bang. You're dead.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Drop it.

Speaker: sanchez
Dialogue: A war does no good for any of us. It can only make what is bad worse.

Speaker: luis
Dialogue: Get them out of here. Fix them up. I want them to be beautiful for their mother.

Speaker: luis
Dialogue: I promise you, my brothers, there will be blood for blood.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: This is the cop.

Speaker: luis
Dialogue: How much did they pay you to set up my brothers, Pig.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Stay off my streets, asshole. Or I'll bite your head off, and shit in your neck.

Speaker: luis
Dialogue: You're meat cop! Dead meat!

Speaker: flannigan
Dialogue: Eenie Verona is the gentleman's name.  You did a hell of a job on him.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I was motivated.

Speaker: flannigan
Dialogue: Know him?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: He's a punk. Punk thief. Booster.

Speaker: flannigan
Dialogue: Looks like he graduated.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: He had a brother-in-law. They were tight. Served time together. Ganelli..., Gagleone...

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Gamiani.

Speaker: flannigan
Dialogue: If I was you, I'd sit on him.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: You figure he's connected?

Speaker: flannigan
Dialogue: Looks like you're gonna be busy, Cusack. Uh, you gonna be using those Cubs' tickets?

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: This Ganiani's a swinger, huh?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: He's just makin' up for the time he spent in the joint.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Now what? They selling protection to the bears?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Relax kid.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Be back in a minute.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: What do you want?

Speaker: lou
Dialogue: Your Papa worries about you.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Get out of here, Lou. Leave me alone.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Hold here a second.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Keep with Gamiani.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Bang a few for me.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Wanna play ball?

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Are you pitching?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Some people say I've got a pretty good inside curve.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I don't know. You look strictly minor league.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I'm Eddie.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I make it Eddie-The-Cop.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: You've had a lot of experience with cops?

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: All bad.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: You'll get slivers.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Hey, what the hell do you think you're doing?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I thought you knew all about cops. You don't put anything up your nose do you?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Diana Luna?  You're Tony Luna's daughter?

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I don't know where he is, and I don't really give a shit.  When are you people going to realize I don't have anything to do with my father.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: For when you need a friend.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I've got all the friends I want.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: But do you have all the friends you need?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Yeah. Crazy Tony Luna. I don't think he's around, but if he shows up bring him in.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Catch you later.

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: Police! Open up!

Speaker: kobas
Dialogue: For Christ's sake! You tryin to get your partner killed, Jackson?

Speaker: brennan
Dialogue: Hey, Mahoney. I want you to help me get some signatures on this letter for Cragie.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: Way to go, partner.

Speaker: howard
Dialogue: Let's try the mitts for awhile.

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: Say, partner.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: How ya doing, Richie?

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: Swinging. How's this? Two G's, we get a sausage and beef stand stand outside Wrigley Field. You pass the beef, I take the cash. Free games. I got a contact downtown.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: How you gonna watch the game if you're hawking sandwiches?

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: Never thought of that. TV? Hey, I tell you about this nurse I met? Talk about physical therapy.

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: She's got this friend just dying to meet you. Intensive care.

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: Later, partner.

Speaker: brennan
Dialogue: Hey, Cusack. How about taking the gloves off long enough to sign this for Cragie.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: This about the hearing?

Speaker: brennan
Dialogue: You bet.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I pass.

Speaker: brennan
Dialogue: What the fuck's the matter with you?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: He's burnt, Brennan, and you know it. He was a good cop, but he ain't now.

Speaker: brennan
Dialogue: Get off your high horse, Cusack. He made a couple of mistakes, OK. The guy was a hero. What the fuck does a bunch of civilians know about comin' up some shithouse stairway day after day, scared outta your shorts.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: We're all scared, Brennan. Cragie should have been off the street a long time ago. He's gonna hurt somebody else with his bullshit. Maybe even you.

Speaker: music
Dialogue: The funeral director says they plan on cruisin right past luna's house.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: They're wastin' the show. Tony's not even in town.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: He'll get the word.

Speaker: luna
Dialogue: I give a shit about their fuckin parade?

Speaker: luna
Dialogue: They wanna throw flowers we can fix it so they're pushing up daisys.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: I can back you up.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Stay by the radio.

Speaker: rocco
Dialogue: What the hell you doin' here? Off, asshole.

Speaker: scalese
Dialogue: Listen. If you have some extra cash, buy oranges. The price is low, and I can promise you the threatened trucking strike will be avoided.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: We talking about a bribe, Scalese?

Speaker: scalese
Dialogue: It's a prediction.

Speaker: scalese
Dialogue: No. I wouldn't try to bribe Eddie Cusack.

Speaker: scalese
Dialogue: You're incorruptible. Untarnished. I hear they call you stainless steel on the street. Me, I think you're a fuckin' pain in the ass.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: scalese
Dialogue: It's not a compliment.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I'm looking for your nephew.

Speaker: scalese
Dialogue: Tony? Forget it. Tony Luna's none of your business.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Wrong. Tony just made himself my business.

Speaker: scalese
Dialogue: No he didn't. We take care of our own. Just like the cops. Just like the Comachos. You understand.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: He shit on my turf, old man. And I'm going to nail him and anybody else tied to him. You understand, Felix?

Speaker: scalese
Dialogue: Nobody threatens Felix Scalese.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: It's not a threat. It's a prediction.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: There's a shitstorm coming. You better get yourself a good umbrella.

Speaker: music
Dialogue: Tony Luna's bagman.

Speaker: music
Dialogue: They call that a Columbian necktie.

Speaker: music
Dialogue: They found the manager of Tony's restaurant hanging from a hook in his kitchen. Looked like someone tried to carve a canoe out of him. Tony's used car lot on Ashland is burning as we speak. The head salesman is a fried zuccini.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Oh Jesus. It's starting.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Let's go.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Music's at the scene.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Was there a girl? Late teens. Reddish hair.

Speaker: pompas
Dialogue: Come on, Chika. We gonna have some fun. You gonna take us to your father.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Pompas, you're getting to be a fucking pain in the ass.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Let her go, pooch.

Speaker: angel
Dialogue: Another step, and I take her head off.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: You don't have the balls.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Where are you taking me?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Downtown first. Then I'm gonna place you in protective custody.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: The hell you are!

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: You'll be safe --

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: I'll take my chances.

Speaker: pirelli
Dialogue: Keep your goddamn pants on!

Speaker: pirelli
Dialogue: This your idea of a social call?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Fred Pirelli, this is Diana. Diana Luna.

Speaker: pirelli
Dialogue: C'mon, kid. Let's get you off your feet.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Can you put her up till I find her old man?

Speaker: pirelli
Dialogue: Does a bear...?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Am I putting you on the spot?

Speaker: pirelli
Dialogue: I spent 30 years on the spot. What ever you need.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Eddie?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I'll be right across the hall. I'm just gonna clean up.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Yeah, at Mike's.

Speaker: music
Dialogue: You oughta crash, man. You had a helluva day.

Speaker: first hood
Dialogue: Love it, Flash. Gonna be a slide. Easy in, easy out.

Speaker: second hood
Dialogue: Just a quick and dirty?

Speaker: first hood
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, nothin to it. You know the drill.

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: He picks her up on Forty-third, and he's takin' in. She says, "Say, baby. Ain't no need for goin' downtown." An' she pulls back her skirt. So the dumb shit climbs in the back an' takes a piece...  ...an' leaves the keys in the front and locks the two of 'em in the squad. And he hasta kick out the window see, an' she starts screamin', "Rape! Rape!" An' they charge him with rape an' every other fuckin' thing in the book. Internal Affairs is gonna give him a kayak and a lantern an' put him out in the lake.

Speaker: second hood
Dialogue: Bartender. Gimme a black russian and a Courvoisier.

Speaker: first hood
Dialogue: Yo! Get your hands up motherfuckers. This is a ho --

Speaker: second hood
Dialogue: You stupid motherfucker.

Speaker: second hood
Dialogue: My old lady tol' me you was fucked up in the head. Do I listen? Piece o cake, you say. Snap, you say. Nothin to it, you say.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Shut up over there.

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: Eddie! Partner! Meet Ruthie. Dental Hygienist. She's oral.

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: And this is... Marlene. She works for a proctologist.

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: Siddown, partner. I got a proposition for you.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Not now, Donato.

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: O.K. O.K. But just let me plant two words in your brain. Alligator farming.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Beer?

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Looks like I'm caught between the rock and the hard place, Sarge.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: You know I really wanted to be a good cop, but... shit. It's hard enough sometimes just to stay alive. Comes so easy to you. You got all the fuckin' answers. Me, I'm still tryin' to find the questions.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Cragie planted the gun on the kid. Just wasted him, and then I... I don't know what to do about the hearing tomorrow...

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Tell the truth.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: See. It's all so nothin' for you. If I talk straight every cop on the force will shit on me. If I don't... Cragie gets away with murder.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: And the chance to do it again. Next time he might take away a cop. That make any difference?

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: He's my partner.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Your partner's selling you out, Kosalas. He kills an unarmed kid, and now he's risking your ass to save his own.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: It was a mistake.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: It cost an innocent kid his life.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: I know that! I KNOW THAT!

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Jesus. I see that kid's face every time I close my eyes.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Tell 'em like it is, Nick. I'll back you up.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: Nice to see you out with the boys for a change, Sarge.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Hello, Cragie.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: They tell me my Sergeant wouldn't sign for me. You want to tell me why?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: You know why.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: No. Tell me.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: You were a good cop for a lot of years. You've passed your limit now Cragie.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: Fuck you. Where do you get off?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Right about here.

Speaker: pirelli
Dialogue: She's havin' a bad night. Gave her a shot of brandy. Maybe she'll sleep.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Giving liquor to a minor, Pirelli?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I'll be back right after the hearing tomorrow, and you can get some sleep then.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: What do you do when you don't have anyone?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: You find someone.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: Could you... Hold me for a while?

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: In the next doorway. Four meters.

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: How you doin', Sarge?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: What's the score?

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: Kid's grandmother says Cragie threw down the pistola.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: Officer Cragie, you have heard Mrs. Murillio's testimony --

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: You have heard her tell this panel that she saw you lay the gun in her grandson's hand.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: I'm not saying the woman would make this up. But there's no way she could have seen anything from where she was standing in a hallway that dark.  Like you said, she's the boy's grandmother.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: If it was dark, Officer, how were you sure Vega had a gun?

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: We were lucky. There was a glint of light, a reflection comin off the barrel of the weapon.

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: You think he'll get a pass?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: You heard it all. What do you think?

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: If the hearing was over I'd have to put my money on the old lady.  But Kosalas's next. My bet's on Cragie.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: The kid may surprise you.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: And right after you heard Officer Cragie's gun discharge, what did you do then?

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: I immediately advanced down the hall.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: And what did you see?

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: The deceased, Vega, lying on the floor. Officer Cragie was checking his vital signs.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: What happened then?

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: We recovered a .25 calibre automatic from the teenager's right hand.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: Did you see that weapon in Vega's hand before Officer Cragie fired?

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: No more questions.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: I'd like to now call Sergeant Cusack.

Speaker: diana
Dialogue: You made that uniform look good.

Speaker: pirelli
Dialogue: That good looking gorilla next to me is Eddie's father. Better than good cop. Killed in the line of duty. '71.  Another cop shot him. An accident.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I can't comment on that. It was over before I got there.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: You are his superior officer, are you not?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Cragie's in my unit, yes.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: Did you give the men their various assignments?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I did.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: Did you request that officer Cragie be on your TAC team?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: No, I didn't.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: Sergeant... I have here a department document dated 24 September, of last year. It is a request by you, to your superiors, to have Officer Cragie transferred to another unit. Are you familiar with this document?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: Why did you request his transfer?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Maybe 30 years is too long for anyone to look at the city's guts, Mr. Partida.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: What happened to this request?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: It was denied.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: This is a letter of support for Officer Cragie.  Why?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I don't agree with what it says.

Speaker: partida
Dialogue: Are you saying you do not believe Officer Cragie is fit to work the streets of Chicago?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: That's what I'm saying.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I just dialed 348-6610, and I get this funny buzz. Check the line for me? Thanks.

Speaker: brennan
Dialogue: Seems to me the man's got his tongue stuck to his asshole, Cragie.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: Hey, that don't bother him. He's the fuckin White Knight.  You wanna take on the whole world by yourself? Now you're gonna get your chance, Sarge.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: He was a friend of yours wasn't he?

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Squad, this is 1462. I need a backup. Have 64 and 63 from TAC 4 meet me at the billiard parlor on 18th near Halsted. Questioning suspects.

Speaker: brennan
Dialogue: Ten-four, Dispatch. Unit 1463 responding.

Speaker: brennan
Dialogue: I could use a cup of coffee.

Speaker: heavy
Dialogue: Hey, you ain't got no business back there.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: I want your opinion I'll beat it out of you.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Where is Luis?

Speaker: degas
Dialogue: Get the hell out of here.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Talk to me, Degas, or I'll hit you with so many lefts you're gonna beg for a right.

Speaker: degas
Dialogue: He's coming here. He's on his way.

Speaker: dispatcher
Dialogue: We need a verification on a back-up

Speaker: second dispatcher
Dialogue: Good luck finding a backup for that character.

Speaker: luis
Dialogue: Take him apart.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Fuck him.

Speaker: luis
Dialogue: The sun comes up. You give me Luna, or the girl dies -- slow.

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: I would have been here, Sarge. They kept it from me.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: You're Ok, Hopalong.

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: Listen, I'm havin' a drink with this friend of mine, name of Mickie. She works on a computer over in the Federal Building, FBI. I got here as soon as I heard.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: They got Diana Luna.

Speaker: donato
Dialogue: That's what I'm tryin' to tell ya. Mickie told me she read on the wire Tony Luna's comin' into Union Station at ten tonight.

Speaker: tony luna
Dialogue: Hello, Felix.

Speaker: scalese
Dialogue: Hello, Tony.

Speaker: scalese
Dialogue: You see, Tony. You make no sense. You start a war... Waste people... Money... You're like a kid, Tony. You're a bad boy.

Speaker: scalese
Dialogue: This sonovabitch is crazy!

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: You tell Luis I got Tony Luna for him. Get me a time and place.

Speaker: luis
Dialogue: Your cop friend is smart. Too smart and he dies. Then I take care of you personally.

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: What the hell is goin on?

Speaker: brennan
Dialogue: Cusack made off with a truckload of armour.

Speaker: music
Dialogue: He's a fucking one man army now.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: What'd I tell ya. The sonofabitch is crazy.

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: OK, everybody. No more games. Where's Cusack.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: I can't swallow this shit! Eddie Cusack's out there takin' on the world by himself. And you fuckin' heros are gonna sit on your goddamn asses!

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: Cool it kid.

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: Don't you fuckin' tell me to cool it. I won't cool it. I'm not going to fuckin' lie for you any more.  I lied, Commander. He laid a gun on that kid. I saw the whole thing.

Speaker: cragie
Dialogue: You little fuckin' bastard!

Speaker: kosalas
Dialogue: What's this for partner? Your next fuck up?

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: Get someone in the air. We're gonna find Cusack.

Speaker: luis
Dialogue: Take off the gag. I want them to hear her.

Speaker: eddie
Dialogue: Here we go partner.

Speaker: luis
Dialogue: Now! Do it now! Kill her!

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: That's Cusack.

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: Hey, Cusack!

Speaker: kates
Dialogue: I'm glad you don't follow orders.
